result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan M Ring was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 01-15-2016 and each month thereafter or penalty of 7 days in jail, consecutive as penalty for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan M Ring

defendant.name: Ring, Jonathan M
defendant.address: 455 Linwood Ave Upper Unit, Oconomowoc, WI 53066

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
From defendant received 4/4/17 requesting Huber privileges.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 4/4/17; Clerk to find out what's he's incarcerated for.

Attorney Jorge R Fragoso in court.   Defendant Jonathan M Ring did not appear.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The State moves to amend the charge to a forfeiture of disorderly conduct.  The Court grants the amendment.  The charge is amended to a county ordinance of disorderly conduct.  The Defendant is sentenced as follows:  FINE: $330.00.  The defendant to pay $50.00 per month commencing 1/15/16 or serve 7 days jail conseuctive as penalty for failure to pay.

Defendant Jonathan M Ring in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Fragoso advises the Court that the Defendant has completed treatment but is still waiting for written proof.  Attorney Fragoso requests additional time for negotiation of the case.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan M Ring in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   The Defendant is currently enrolled in treatment.  Attorney Fragoso requests the matter be set for disposition.   Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan M Ring in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant needs to complete anger management. Defense requests a review date in 60 days. Court will give a date in 45 days. Defense to advise how this matter will proceed on the next date.  Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint.    Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Jonathan M Ring in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. WCS addressed. Defense is requesting that Defendant comply with screening report from WCS be removed. Court orders this condition be removed. Other conditions remain.   Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint.   Defendant to comply with screening report from WCS. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Jonathan M Ring in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
